title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 5
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose M and m consecutively states the biggest number and the smallest number between all 4-digit numbers that has the total digit value of 9. What is the biggest prime factor of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M\\quad -\\quad m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]}]}

title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 6
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Review equation that has a form of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ x }^{ 2 }\\quad +\\quad bx\\quad +\\quad c\\quad =\\quad 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". How many equations thus that the equation has real roots if coefficient b and c can only be chosen from {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}?"}]}]}

title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 8
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A water drain is supposed to be made with a pipe with diameter of 10 cm. But only small pipes are available, those small pipes has a diameter of 3 cm. So that the capacity of the water drain isn't smaller than what is wanted, at least how many 3 cm pipes are needed to be used as the substitute of one 10cm pipe?"}]}]}
